result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Herbert C. Grosenheider Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Raabe states DE will enter pleas today.  Stipulation filed re: supplemental facts.  State files amended information in 15CF254 and then states recs.  Atty Raabe is in agreement, acknowledges rec. amended information in 15CF254, waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Raabe enters Guilty pleas in both counts of amended information.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Court dismisses but reads in 15CF15 and 14CF299.  Court orders PSI not later than 4/29/2016 w/sentencing to be set some time after that date.  Bond continued pending sentencing.

15CF254
Ct 1:  Guilty
Ct 2:  Guilty
PSI requested - State caps recommendation at 25 years prison (some IC and some ES)

15CF15 - Dismissed/read-in

14CF299 - Dismissed/read-in

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is not yet resolved, however new accepted offer just received.  Request a bit more time to discuss the offer further.  Get new date from Br. 2.  Trial remains on at this point.  Bond continues.

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 2.  Bond continues.

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Benavides gives status.  All matters are not yet resolved.  Request for preliminary hearing on all cases.   Time limits continued waived.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
rd  Return date scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney  Lawton appears. Reset to track.  Return date scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on April 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lawton requests two month reset in an attempt to resolve this matter.  State objects to such a long set over, then changes her mind.  Court resets.  Bonds continued.  Return date scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Return date on February 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. DE qualifies for PD represenation.  State requests $2500.00 cash bond.  Atty. ORourke makes bail argument for PA bond and explains non appearance.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2000.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute Sobriety  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
